availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, teamster. Native of Scotland. Educated in Scotland. Operated lumber yard in Louisville.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 4, p. 20.
Edwards' Annual Director to the Inhabitants, Institutions, Incorporated Companies, Manufacturing Establishments, Business firms, Etc., Etc., in the City of Louisville, For 1868 (St. Louis and New York: Edwards & Co. Publishers, 1868), p. 299.
“Dies as Recluse,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky.), June 5, 1907, p. 3.
Find A Grave, "Alexander M. Mackay (unknown-1907)," Memorial #149138543, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/149138543 (accessed October 6, 2017).
